tag.narrative: 11.6 - By 2030, reduce the adverse per capita environmental impact of cities, including by paying special attention to air quality and municipal and other waste management.
11.6 - Till 2030 minska städernas negativa miljöpåverkan per person, bland annat genom att ägna särskild uppmärksamhet åt luftkvalitet samt hantering av kommunalt och annat avfall.
7.3 - By 2030, double the global rate of improvement in energy efficiency.
7.3 - Till 2030 fördubbla den globala förbättringstakten vad gäller energieffektivitet.

description.narrative: The Sida investment grant is to be used to (i) co-finance purchasing of a 4MW biofuel boiler along with the auxiliary equipment at the Troleybusna boiler house, and (ii) finance up to 144 individual heat substations (“IHSs”). Currently, the heating control according to weather condition is only done centrally at the boiler house or central heating substation. Heat generation follows specially developed pattern and the consumers have no means to control the heat consumption. Buildings are often over-heated (during inter-seasons like warm autumn or spring) and also have different levels of insulation, but receive the same amount of heat. The heat supplied to buildings is not controlled with regard to weather. The hot tap water consumption is not controlled. The above situation calls for establishment of the demand side management. Introduction of the IHSs will save energy and increase the comfort of the end-consumers by accurate regulation of heat, which is expected to match the actual, fluctuating needs of the buildings and individual needs of the consumers. Generally, the conversion will also decrease the heat demand and consequently lower the costs of required upgrading of the heat generation facilities. The introduction of IHSs has a significant impact on the performance of the district heating system. IHSs will be equipped with heat and domestic hot water exchangers. The IHSs will be installed at the building level, allowing for a more accurate distribution of thermal energy to the clients, improving the customers’ control of the service. It is proposed to install 144 IHSs with heat exchangers in the areas of Doroshenka, Troleybusna and Nadvirnyanska – Khotkevicha districts. The average benefits of this component are summarised below: 1. Lower energy supply to the connected building in the district, corresponding to reduced use of gas corresponding to 2.44 million Nm3 gas annually; 2. Decrease of electricity consumption due to IHSs installation will result in 162 MWh annually; 3. CO2 savings of 4 900 tonnes per year; 4. Improved conditions for supply also of hot water. The component could not be financed without grant funds as repayment of investments related to demand side management measures cannot be included in the DH tariffs. As heat generation in Ivano-Frankivsk was based on imported natural gas, the Company was looking into the possibility to replace some of gas consumption with alternative fuels, mainly biomass. Grant support of this component was required to ensure that the Company selects a modern biomass boiler with high level of efficiency, which is fully compliant with the EU standards, and such boilers are capital intensive. The grant will stimulate use of the latest biomass burning technologies and stimulate the local biomass market development. The average benefits of this component are summarised below: 1. Gas savings of 2.9 million Nm³ per year; 2. CO2 savings of 5 620 tonnes per year. Currently there are four completed contracts related to the entire Ivano-Frankivsk District Heating Project: 1. Contract with Kriger (Ukraine) for rehabilitation of the boiler house at Medychna St. (Contract value: EUR 484,800 including VAT signed in September 2015); 2. Contract with Enertex (France, Ukraine) for modernization and rehabilitation of the boiler house at Vyskovykh Veteraniv St. (Final contract value: EUR 496,634 including VAT, signed in February 2016); 3. Contract with Enerstena (Lithuania) for the supply and installation of the 4MW biomass boiler at Troleybusna St. (Contract value: EUR 1,193,106 including EUR 799,200 of SIDA grant funds and VAT on the loan funds, signed in August 2016); 4. Contract with Progress 92 (Ukraine) for replacement of pipes at Stusa and Khotkevicha St., which is a part of the heating network rehabilitation component (Contract value: EUR 312,904 - signed in June 2017). The reconstructed boiler houses located at Medychna and Vyskovykh Veteraniv Streets were commissioned during the 2016/2017 heating season, while the boiler house at Troleybusna St. together with the largest biomass-fired boiler in the city was commissioned in December 2017. All the reconstructed boiler houses have generated savings for the Company since their commissioning. The modernization of the boiler house at 68a Dovha St started and is expected to be completed in October 2019. The Company also launched a tender regarding modernization of the last boiler house (28a Doroshenka Street) stipulated by the Project with the installation of a new 3 MW biofuel boiler. The first stage evaluation report related to the Doroshenka boiler house was submitted to the Bank in March 2019. Opening of the financial proposals related to the IHS tender was scheduled for 4 April 2019. The Company expects to receive financial proposals from four tenderers.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
